intro: Urera radula, commonly known as the red urera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
